text:
The Union government on Saturday raised the excise duty on petrol by 37 paise a litre and on diesel Rs. 2, the second such increase in just over two weeks.

However, the retail selling prices of the fuels remain unchanged as state-owned oil firms had not passed on the full benefit of a reduction in international oil prices to consumers on January 1.

The increase in excise duty will fetch the government over Rs. 4,300 crore on diesel and about Rs. 80 crore on petrol. — PTI
title: Excise duty on petrol, diesel hiked
